tools.name: ATCC Genome Portal (American Type Culture Collection)
gfaestus
tools.note: See demo video displaying GFF3 annotations on graph https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=A-HnKXIrJl4

tools.name: BLAST+ (reading -outfmt 0 pairwise output is the original CLI bioinformatics!)
pyBamView
tools.note: See supplementary info for more figures, supports padded SAM/BAM which is fairly rare

tools.name: MapView
tools.note: links in original paper are dead, but URL provided here works

tools.name: JBrowse
tools.note: See also JBrowse plugin registry https://gmod.github.io/jbrowse-registry. Runs on the web or as a desktop app using Electron

tools.name: JBrowse 2
tools.note: See gallery for more examples https://jbrowse.org/jb2/gallery

tools.name: PURPLE
tools.note: part of the PURPLE/GRIDSS/LINX pipeline, stands for purity ploidy estimator
intermutation-distance rainfall plots/katagesis plots are not technically in genomic coordinates, but do indicate genomic cluster of variatnts

tools.name: bcftools roh
tools.note: Plots runs of homozygosity, has interactive plot-roh.py helper too

tools.name: mocha
tools.note: Has a full analysis pipeline associated with end result visualizations

tools.name: ALVIS (MSA viewer)
tools.note: Introduces sequence bundles concept, also see web app version https://www.ebi.ac.uk/goldman-srv/sequencebundles/

tools.name: Nextclade
tools.note: Related usage on nextstrain app also

tools.name: udon
tools.note: Uses an advanced data structure for pileup, so visually a basic example but likely just a small demo

tools.name: AnnoJ
tools.note: See list of instances of the browser here https://ecker.salk.edu/genome-browser/

tools.name: ProViz
tools.note: See also alphafold visualization as tracks http://slim.icr.ac.uk/projects/alphafold?page=alphafold_proviz_homepage

tools.name: oxford-plots
tools.note: Has nice description of a synteny pipeline here https://github.com/jherrero/oxford-plots/blob/master/examples/pig_X_Y.txt
